title.narrative: SDG RELEVANT CHILD-FOCUSED BUDGETS

description.narrative: National and local authorities are equipped to plan for, generate, efficiently use and report upon robust and credible child- focused budgets, and to leverage domestic and external resources for equitable, child-focused investments to achieve child- and adolescent-relevant SDGs., which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Access To Inclusive Social Protection (Covid), Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation, Cross Sectoral - Children With Disabilities, Cross Sectoral - Children With Disabilities (Covid), Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Reducing Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Partnerships And Engagement: Public And Private, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Children and adolescents, particularly the most marginalized, progressively benefit from inclusive national and municipal government policies, budgets and programmes that are evidence-based and which prioritise the best interest of children and youth in public finance and public spending.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: National and local authorities are equipped to plan for, generate, efficiently use and report upon robust and credible child-focused budgets, and to leverage domestic and external resources for equitable, child-focused investments to achieve child- andadolescent-relevant SDGs.

description.narrative: UNICEF has renewed and strengthened its engagement on child poverty and, in partnership with the World Bank, has significantly advanced the knowledge base on the impact of public spending on prosperity and resilience in the sectors of health, education and social protection, in addition to providing humanitarian cash transfers to almost 2,000 families with children in the impoverished region of South-East Serbia. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:05/01/2022
